com.stormpath.sdk.group
Class Groups

java.lang.Object
  com.stormpath.sdk.group.Groups

public final class Groups
extends Object

Static utility/helper methods for working with Group resources. Most methods are factory methods used for forming Group-specific fluent DSL queries. For example: 

 Groups.where(Groups.name().containsIgnoreCase("Foo"))
     .and(Groups.status().eq(GroupStatus.ENABLED))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(50)
     .limitTo(25));
or, if using static imports: 
 import static com.stormpath.sdk.group.Groups.*;

 ...

 where(name().containsIgnoreCase("Foo"))
     .and(status().eq(GroupStatus.ENABLED))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(50)
     .limitTo(25));

Since:
0.8

Method Detail

options

public static GroupOptions<GroupOptions> options()
Returns a new GroupOptions instance, used to customize how one or more Groups are retrieved.

Returns:
a new GroupOptions instance, used to customize how one or more Groups are retrieved.

criteria

public static GroupCriteria criteria()
Returns a new GroupCriteria instance to use to formulate a Group query.

Note that it is usually more common to use the where method instead of this one as the where method usually lends to better readability. For example: 

 Groups.criteria().add(Groups.name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
versus: 
 Groups.where(Groups.name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
or when using static imports: 
 where(name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
While all three statements are equivalent, the second and third examples are shorter and probably more readable.

Returns:
a new GroupCriteria instance to use to formulate a Group query.

where

public static GroupCriteria where(Criterion criterion)
Creates a new GroupCriteria instance using the specified criterion as the first query condition.

Returns:
a new GroupCriteria instance using the specified criterion as the first query condition.

name

public static StringExpressionFactory name()
Creates a new StringExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Group name property, to be used to construct a name Criterion when building an GroupCriteria query. For example: 
 Groups.where(Groups.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
The above example invokes the returned factory's startsWithIgnoreCase("foo") method. This produces a name-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
 GroupCriteria criteria = Groups.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory nameExpressionFactory = Groups.name();
 Criterion nameStartsWithFoo = nameExpressionFactory.startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
 criteria.add(nameStartsWithFoo);
The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.

Returns:
a new name-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an GroupCriteria query.

description

public static StringExpressionFactory description()
Creates a new StringExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Group description property, to be used to construct a description Criterion when building an GroupCriteria query. For example: 
 Groups.where(Groups.description().startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
The above example invokes the returned factory's startsWithIgnoreCase("foo") method. This produces a description-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
 GroupCriteria criteria = Groups.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory descriptionExpressionFactory = Groups.description();
 Criterion descriptionStartsWithFoo = descriptionExpressionFactory.startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
 criteria.add(descriptionStartsWithFoo);
The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.

Returns:
a new description-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an GroupCriteria query.

status

public static EqualsExpressionFactory status()
Creates a new EqualsExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Group status property, to be used to construct a status Criterion when building an GroupCriteria query. For example: 
 Groups.where(Groups.status().eq(GroupStatus.ENABLED);
The above example invokes the returned factory's eq() method. This produces a status-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
 GroupCriteria criteria = Groups.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory statusExpressionFactory = Groups.status();
 Criterion statusEqualsEnabled = statusExpressionFactory.eq(GroupStatus.ENABLED);
 criteria.add(statusEqualsEnabled);
The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.

Returns:
a new status-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an GroupCriteria query.

newCreateRequestFor

public static CreateGroupRequestBuilder newCreateRequestFor(Group group)
Creates a new CreateGroupRequestBuilder instance reflecting the specified Group instance. The builder can be used to customize any creation request options as necessary.

Parameters:
group - the group to create a new record for within Stormpath
Returns:
a new CreateGroupRequestBuilder instance reflecting the specified Group instance.
Since:
0.9
See Also:
Application.createGroup(CreateGroupRequest)
